constraints Package¶

Description¶

Store information about various types of constraints, and generate the corresponding Z3 input.

BracketedConstraint Module¶

Created on Apr 29, 2013

@author: ezulkosk

Bases: constraints.BracketedConstraint.ExprArg

Convenience class that extends ExprArg and holds a boolean instance.

class constraints.BracketedConstraint.BracketedConstraint(z3, claferStack)¶

Bases: builtins.object

Variables:stack – ([]) Used to process a tree of expressions.

Class for creating bracketed Clafer constraints in Z3.

class constraints.BracketedConstraint.ExprArg(joinSorts, instanceSorts, instances)¶

Bases: builtins.object

Parameters:
  • joinSorts ([ClaferSort]) – The list of sorts used to determine which ClaferSorts to join.
  • instanceSorts – The list of sorts that are actually in instances.
  • instances ([Int()]) – The set of Z3-int expressions associated with the bracketed constraint up to this point.

Struct used to hold information as a bracketed constraint is traversed.

modifyInstances(newInstances)¶
Parameters:newInstances ([Int()]) –
Returns:ExprArg

Returns the old ExprArg, with its instances changed to newInstances.

class constraints.BracketedConstraint.IntArg(instances)¶

Bases: constraints.BracketedConstraint.ExprArg

Convenience class that extends ExprArg and holds an integer instance.

constraints.BracketedConstraint.createJoinFunction(leftSort, rightSort, linstances, rinstances, zeroedVal)¶
Parameters:
  • leftSort (ClaferSort) –
  • rightSort (ClaferSort) –
  • linstances ([Int()]) –
  • rinstances ([Int()]) –
  • zeroedVal (int) – the number of parentInstances of rightSort, or zero if rightSort is “int”
Returns:

Z3-function(int, int)

Creates a Z3-function that ranges over len(rinstances). For each index in rinstances, returns the instance if its corresponding instance in linstances is on , else the instances is masked to be zeroedVal.

>>> zeroedVal = 3
>>> leftSort.parentInstances = 1
>>> linst = [0,0,1]
>>> rinst = [0,1,1,2,2,3]
>>> join([0,0,1], [0,1,1,2,2,3]) 
>>>    => [mask(0), mask(1), mask(1), mask(2), mask(2), mask(3]]
>>>    => [0,1,1,3,3,3]

Here, since linst[2] = leftSort.parentInstances, any instance in rinstances that points to linst[2] is zeroed. The other instances remain the same.

constraints.BracketedConstraint.getOperationConversion(op)¶
Parameters:op (str) – String representation of Clafer operation.
Returns:2-tuple from ClaferToZ3OperationsMap with the fields:
The 2-tuple has the fields:
  1. arity of the function
  2. function associated with the operator
constraints.BracketedConstraint.joinWithSuper(sort, instances)¶
Parameters:
  • sort (ClaferSort) –
  • instances ([Int()]) –
Returns:

(ClaferSort, [Int()])

Maps each instance of the subclafer sort to the corresponding super instance. Returns the super sort and its instances.

constraints.BracketedConstraint.set_extend(left, right)¶
Parameters:
  • left (ExprArg) –
  • right (ExprArg) –
Returns:

ExprArg

Extends two sets to facilitate set operations. Simplified Example:

>>> Extend(Set(A,B), Set(B,C)) => (Set(A,B,C), Set(A,B,C))

In this case, the C’s in the left set are “zeroed”, and the A’s in the right set are “zeroed.”
